section.title: Install the dashboard
section.para: Before you can install and configure the dashboard, meet the requirements in .

note.para: When you install Object Storage and Identity only, even if you install the Dashboard, it does not pull up projects and is unusable.

section.para: For more information about how to deploy the dashboard, see Deploying Horizon.

step.para: Install the dashboard on the node that can contact the Identity Service as root:

screen.userinput: yum install memcached python-memcached mod_wsgi openstack-dashboard
zypper install memcached python-python-memcached apache2-mod_wsgi openstack-dashboard

step.para: Modify the value of CACHES['default']['LOCATION'] in /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.py/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py to match the ones set in /etc/memcached.conf/etc/sysconfig/memcached.conf.
Open /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.py /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings and look for this line:

listitem.para: The address and port must match the ones set in /etc/memcached.conf/etc/sysconfig/memcached.
If you change the memcached settings, you must restart the Apache web server for the changes to take effect.
You can use options other than memcached option for session storage. Set the session back-end through the SESSION_ENGINE option.

To change the timezone, use the dashboard or edit the /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.py/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py file.

step.para: You can now access the dashboard at http://controller/horizon.
Login with credentials for any user that you created with the OpenStack Identity Service.
